content.title: Admission
content.content: One has to top in HSC as well as at the decorated CUET examinations. Since, it's a centralised examination, so students can fill their choices and if the score is as per their choice, they will get the college of his/her choice. So, if you are in the top draw and you are getting as per your preference, then during the counselling just hand over the DD and admissions are confirmed then and there itself.

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview

We do have taxation and other important subjects in our syllabus but one can master his/her area in our course. So, I don't think elsewhere this is possible but at DU it is.

content.title: Admission
content.content: The procedure for taking admission in Shri Ram am College of Commerce entrance exam which is known as cuet. The exam has been taken every year by National testing agency. The total marks in the exam was 800 and forgetting admission in SRCC you have to score at least 782 general category and 750 for other categories. The college provide only two courses BCom honours and eco honours. Tera total 800 seats in bcom hons and 400 seats in Eco hons. After the cuet result has been declared by NTA you have to register for du website for taking admission. Then the cutoff list has been every college will you can see which college you get the admission. I get that admission in the first cut off without even going to another college such as Hindu College, Hansraj College.

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview

Even the companies which are come in placement cells are also looking for the practicals examinations of the subject that we all ready done in our curriculum. Introduction new new education policy also unable us to lot of things in other than practical and theory examination such as yoga, sport and other things in the form of SEC ,DSE,AECCsubject

content.title: Admission
content.content:
I applied to only the colleges of delhi university. I also applied for banasthali college in Rajasthan as my backup. But my main goal was Delhi university. 
Delhi university includes all the best colleges of india and being a government everyone opt for it. 
Srcc has the highest cuttoff and is known for its best placements and is the best college of asia for commerce hence i choose this above every college.


No i didnt get any rejection from any college because one first preference was only sri ram college of commerce and i got into it.

For getting into srcc delhi university i had to give exam called cuet ug. 
As i wanted to do bcom hons i had to give my exams for 4 subjects 
1- Accounts/applied maths/ core maths ( any one ) 
2- business studies 
3- English 
4- Economics ( or any other subject which you have learnt in 11th 12th eg physical education etc)


The first cuttoff score was 782 and it drops a bit as the rounds proceeds.
The overall exam giving of cuet was tiring as there was no proper management done during exams. 
The exam marks were also so delayed so it was quite tiring waiting for the results

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview
content.content:
The main subjects of my course that is bcom hons is fine which includes business law financial accounting management and one general elective that is microeco of mine.
But the subjects of VAC SEC AEC is i feel waste of time. 
I think these should not be included in the curriculum because on ground relality it doesnt add much value to us. 
If i give an example like i have chosen vedic maths as my SEC , but in that basic addition multiplication etc is been thought. This everyone had studied in their school which is so basic that the ones who have not studied would also know. So its more of a waste of time as we have to attend the classes just because of thw attendance.

The class test was conducted of 24 marks which included 3 questions of 12 marks each and you have to attempt any 2 
Timing was of 1 hr

content.title: Student view on course curriculum and faculty
content.content: I got know about Economics (hons) when I was in Class X. It was my sister who told me about the course, who was already in Delhi University. I got really interested in Economics at that time and chose Commerce in Class XI. I also got know that not only this is one the hardest courses in Delhi University, but also one of the most rewarding courses, providing very high placements. The faculty:student ratio of Shri Ram College of Commerce is around 1:50. All the faculty of Shri Ram College of Commerce is highly qualified with many teachers having more than 30 years of experience in teaching. Although, our session started really late, the term exams were pretty much on time.

content.title: Top company recruiting from the campus , average and highest package
content.content:
The placements of Shri Ram College of Commerce are one the highest in Delhi Univerisity. For the session 2023-23, the highest package was 35 lpa, average package was 10.15 lpa, median package was 8 lpa and the gross placement value was 51.6 crore.
There were more than 100 recruiters from more than 15 sectors, including McKinsey & Co., BCG, Bain & Co., Kearny, Accenture, Delloite, JP Morgan & Co., etc. with more than 500 offers. The Placement Cell also launched an initiative of assissting people with special abilities to secure placements and interships.
As of now, I have not settled to what I am going to do after graduation.

content.title: Yearly fees structure and scholarship
content.content: The fees of any course is really low in Delhi Univeristy, with Fees of BA (hons) Economics ranging from 5k to 35k per year. What is costly is the expenditure on accomodation. Living in Delhi around North Campus can be really expensive with a double sharing PG costing between 1.5 lacs to 2.5 lacs depnding on various factors like location, facilities, etc. I did not apply for any scholoarships however two of my friends got scholarships worth 12k and 25k from the College itself. Also, two my seniors got an intership of worth 2.5 lacs by Hindustan Unilever Limited.

content.title: Annual fest and various activity in the campus
content.content:
SRCC conducts one of the largest annual fests of the Delhi Univeristy, called "Crossroads". It is held for 4 days with new celebrities and singers coming each day. It also conducts the Asia's largest unergraduate management fest, called "Business Conclave". It is held for 3 days with people coming from various fields.
As SRCC offers 2 courses in Undergraduation, most of the books in library are related to them only, ie, Economics and Commerce related subjects like Finance, etc. However, there is still a big pool of books for every for every reader.
Every classroom in SRCC is centrally airconditioned and has a smartboard.
The Sports Complex of SRCC is the largest compared to any college in DU. It has a seating capacity of 1200 with changing rooms, sauna baths, gyms, rehabilitation center, etc. for players. One can play many sports like badminton, basketball, football, baseball. etc.
SRCC is also very famous for its student-run societies, like Dramatics Society, Economics Society, etc.

content.title: Hostel facilities provided by the college
content.content:
I live in the hostel of SRCC which is on campus only. Most of the rooms are double sharing with some rooms being triple sharing and even single as well. In boys hostel, one gets a study table, side table, mirror and a shared almirah. There is proper ventilation with a window however there is no airconditioning or cooller provided by the college.
The hostel application form is provided on the Announcements tab on the SRCC website itself. It is quite a tedious process to register for the hostel as they require many things. Hostel is alloted on the basis of your marks. 
Hostel is very affordable compared to a PG or flat outside college. It takes less than 5 minutes to reach the classroom from hostel. 
The menu of the mess keeps on changing every few weeks and and quality of the food is actually pretty good compared to the image people have for hostel mess food.

content.title: Admission process and eligibility criteria
content.content: Currently, I am pursuing BA (hons) Economics from Shri Ram College of Commerce, Delhi University. For one to pursue this course, they must have either Mathematics or Applied Mathematics in their Class 12, as well as one of their Domain Subjects in CUET. One has give CUET (Common University Entrance Test) to get admitted into any of the Central Universities, like Delhi University. Unlike the procedure followed earlier of releasing the cutoff, DU has followed a new procedure of CSAS (Common Seat Allocation System) for allocating seats to the applicants. Under this system, the cutoff is not released, rather, one has to make a preference list of their courses and colleges and a combination is allocated according to their marks. I got admitted in DU through Scheduled Caste Reservation. The CUET exam can be made better by making it a more streamlined process and conducting exams in the given schedule only. Clearer communication from UGC as well as NTA will also be helpful.

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview
content.content: I first had plans to take up Bcom hons but later changed seeing the vast and diverse curriculum of Eco hons here at DU. Although it is a bit more difficult than bcom hons but ultimately the knowledge you get from eco hons cannot be matched with bcom hons. Also the placements for eco hons is better

content.title: Internships Opportunities
content.content: Since I have just joined college, I do not have much idea about the internships and stipends but what I have heard from my seniors is that the internship opportunities are good but for very good opportunities it's best to apply yourself.

content.title: Placement Experience
content.content: The college placements are quite good with highest packages going upto 36 lakhs. Although I am thinking to pursue Masters after this and not considering a placement just after undergrad. The college placements are pretty good but only for people who have worked hard and have good grades.

content.title: Fees and Financial Aid
content.content: My total fees for the general category is Rs 33425 and there is no breakup given to us regarding the fees. I do not have much clue about the fees for other categories and as far as scholarships are concerned, we have ample opportunities ranging from Dr SN Maheshwari Scholarship to Reliance Foundation Undergrad Scholarship. We also have access to the national scholarship portal.

content.title: Campus Life
content.content: Firstly, I am unhappy with the infrastructure and DUSU elections. Apart from that, everything here at SRCC and DU is pretty good with every college organising amazing fests and events. The inter college competitions are also very good.

content.title: Faculty
content.content: I feel the faculty to be utterly good and not only teaching us the syllabus but giving life lessons as well. In this regard, Professor Ashwini for Microeconomics is the best person. As far as exams are concerned, we have a total of 150 marks out of which 90 marks is the final exam and 60 is the internals, which comprises of attendance, continuous assessment and class tests.

content.title: Admission
content.content: I had gotten selected for Christ Bangalore, NMIMS, NMCCE and St Xaviers Kolkata, apart from SRCC but I still chose SRCC as it is one of the best colleges in the field to offer this course and also has a reputed name for itself.

review_data.name: Navneet

content.title: Student view on course curriculum and faculty
content.content:
I chose this course because of SRCC brand name and broad course curriculum and a knack to learn more about how global businesses operates.
Faculty-Student ratio is really good as the batch size is vey small.
The faculty members are well experienced and have been in the industry for many years.
The method of teaching is student centric.
A healthy mixture of personal and group assignment,case studies, interactive videos to ensure student engagement.
The term exams are conducted on a timely basis and if a student has paid sufficient attention in the classes then exams turns out to be moderate.

content.title: Internship opportunity provided by the college and stipend
content.content:
The placement committee works hard to onboard best companies with niche roles for the students of the entire batch.
Domains like Finance,Marketing, Strategy, Data Analytics and Operations drives maximum opportunities.
Roles in each of these domains are pretty good.
According to the placement report for the batch 2021-2023 the average stipend is 40,000 and the highest stipend turns out to be 3,00,000.

content.title: Placement provided by the college and average package
content.content:
From second year students who complete their summer internships are eligible for campus placements.
According to glimpse of placement report for the batch 2021-2023 mentioned on the official linkedin account the average placement is 13,48,000 Lakhs per annum and the median package is 13,00,000 Lakhs per annum.
The prominent roles are offered in the field of finance,marketing,analytics and strategy and many more.
Almost all the students in the batch gets placed.
My plans are to work in a good reputed company and gain a good position in the field.

content.title: Total fees of the course
content.content:
The fees for the entire two year course is 3,20,000 Lakhs i.e. 1,60,000 lakhs per year.
Hostel facilities are very limited.
The cost to study is quite low as compared to other MBA colleges and therefore the Return on Investment of the college is exceptionally good.

content.title: Annual fest and various activity in the campus
content.content:
Ygantar is tghe annual fest conducted in month of March or April.
The library of SRCC hold variety of books thereby assisting the students a very easy access to strengthen their conceptual knowledge.
The research papers and journals guides students regarding the application of concepts.
Classrooms are air conditioned with comfortable seating arrangements and projector facilities.
There are large number of committees and clubs in our college with most important being: 
1- Placement Committee
2- Training and Development Cell - To upskill the students of the batch
3- Agrata- For HR
4- Helios - For Marketing.
5- Ekatva Society for sports
6- Karvaan for Events management.
7- Aluminati for maintaining alumni relations.

content.title: Admission process and eligibility criteria
content.content:
SRCC-PGDGBO admission mandates a minimum 50% in Bachelor's degree from a recognised university with a relaxation of 5% to the candidates belonging to SC,ST,OBC,CW and PwBD categories.
Applicants in their final year can also apply but admission is contigent on presenting the qualifying degree results.
Application Form: Available on SRCC Website under "Announcements" Tab on Homepage.
Application Window: 11th December 2023 to 24th January 2024

pos_sentences: Faculty with great experience and industry knowledge
Return on investment is exceptional. Without using external financing, students can complete their education.
Brand name is something which is invaluable and stays with you forever. Having SRCC brand name in your CV is a great start for anyone's career.
neg_sentences: we have semester system in our course which i think should be converted to trimester system like other B-school.

review_data.title: Proud Srccian

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview
content.content:
I choose this course because of SRCC brand name, great course curriculum with great faculty and i wanted to study global business.
Faculty-student ratio is really good as batch size is very less. The faculty member are well experienced and have been in the industry for many years.
The teacher method is student centric. A healthy mixture of personal and group assignment, case studies, interactive videos to ensure student engagement.
The term exams are conducted on a timely basis and if a student has paid sufficient attention in the classes then exam are Moderate to difficult.

content.title: Internships Opportunities
content.content:
D.E.Shaw - Rs.100000 per month 
Role- Financial operations
responsibilites- account payable process for both vendors as well as employees including, but not limited to, capturing and routing invoices, getting business approvals, and allocating and coding invoices in the account payable module.

content.title: Placement Experience
content.content:
From second year students who complete their summer internship are eligible for campus placement.
According to glimpse of the placements for the batch 2021-23 mentioned on official linkedin account the average placement is 13.48 LPA and the median package is 13LPA
The Prominent roles are offered in the field of finance, marketing, analytics and strategy and many more.
Almost all the students in the batch gets placed.
My plans are to work in a good reputed company and gain a good position in the field.

content.title: Fees and Financial Aid
content.content:
The fees for the entire two year course is 320000. That is 160000 per year.
Hostel facilities are very limited.
The cost to study is quite low as compared to other MBA colleges and therefore the ROI of the college is exceptionally good.

content.title: Campus Life
content.content:
Yugantar is the annual fest conducted in April.
The library of SRCC hold variety of books thereby assisting the students a very access to strngthen their conceptual knowledge. The resseach papers and journals guide students regarding the application of such concepts.
There are good seating space, classes are spacious with A/C and Projector facilities.
There are many variety od clubs and socities in college which are student driven:
1. Placement Committee
2. Training and development committee
3. Agrata for HR
4. Finantix for Finance and consulting
5. Helios for Marketing
6. Training and development cell
7. Karawaan for event management 
8. CII YUVA society for Entrepreneurship
9. Data factory for Data Analysis
10. Ekatva for sports
11. Internacia for global business study 
12. Aluminati for alumini networking
13. Public relation cell

content.title: Admission
content.content:
Eligibility : Any student completed graduation or in final year of graduation can apply.
Application form, fees and dates can be found on the srccgbo official website.
Reservation are given to SC, ST, OBC(non-creamy layer)
No i think whole process was quite smooth and well structured.

review_data.review_images_title: Shri Ram College of Commerce - [SRCC]|New Delhi

pos_sentences: Campus is very huge and great its all green
Placement is the best part also the ROI is amazing
Sports Complex is very huge and all most every sports equipment is available
neg_sentences: The semester system followed is less challenging a trimester system would have been more challenging
review_data.title: SRCC the best ROI college
review_data.name: Tanmoy Saha

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview
content.content:
The course curriculum is fixed as per University guidelines.
But add on courses are arranged by college to assist students get in knowledge with current industry trends. 
The batch size here is small so it ensures that Faculty-Student ratio. 
Faculty members are well experienced and have been in the industry for a couple of years. 
The teaching method is decided with consultation with students to ensure that it is student centric. 
Various methods are used for teaching be it personal and group assignments, case studies, interactive video content to ensure that students learn while engaging. 
The course follows semester based pattern and term exams are conducted on a timely basis. 
The exams are moderate to difficult and focused more on practical application of the concepts learned.

content.title: Internships Opportunities
content.content:
D.E. Shaw Role- Financial Analyst Stipend- 1,00,000 per month 
Adani came to campus for the role of operations, sales and marketing. 
DCM Shriram for the role of marketing. 
The roles offered are varied ranging from marketing., finance, human resources, strategy etc. thus posing sufficient amount of opportunities for the students of the batch to leatn.

content.title: Placement Experience
content.content:
According to the glimpse of the placements for the batch 2021-2023 mentioned in the official LinkedIn account for the average placement is 13,48,000 Lakhs per annum and the median package is 13,00,000 Lakhs per annum. 
Prominent roles are offered in the field of Finance, Marketing, Analytics and strategy, Human resources and many more. 
The students are eligible for the placements after completion of their Summer internships.

content.title: Fees and Financial Aid
content.content:
The best part of the Global Business Operations course is it's Return on Investment.
The total cost for the entire two year course is 3,20,000 Lakhs and the median package is touching upto 11 lakhs which is pretty great. Thus ensuring that Return on investment is easily three to four times. 
The cost to study is one of the best as compared to other institutions
Our internship process is still going on most of the renowned companies like DESHAW, AMEX, ADANI, ADOBE and etc have already visited the campus and offered a wholesome package for internship

content.title: Campus Life
content.content:
The library in Shri Ram College of Commerce hold variety of books thereby assisting the students a very easy access to strengthen their conceptual knowledge. The research papers and journals guide students regarding the application of such concepts. 
A number of opportunities are provided by the committees and clubs for the overall development of the students in the batch. 
Several industry interaction sessions are conducted on a periodic basis to help students get well versed with the current industry trends and learn from the best. 
An annual management conclave is conducted named as Yugantar in which various interaction sessions, guest lectures and case study competition are conducted.

content.title: Admission
content.content:
Shri Ram College Of Commerce Post Graduate Diploma in Global Business Operations admission mandates a minimum 50% in Bachelor's Degree from a recognized university with a relaxation of 5% for a certain categories ( SC, ST, OBC, CW, PwBD). Apllicants in final year can also apply but admission is provisional based on qualifying degree results. 
The application form can be found on SRCC website. 
Application fees: 2500/- (For General, OBC) and 1500/- (For SC, ST, EWS, PwBD categories) 
Application Date: 11.12.2023 to 24.01.2024

review_data.review_images_title: Shri Ram College of Commerce - [SRCC]|New Delhi

pos_sentences: The facilities provided are one of the best in kind from Centralised Aur conditioners to projectors there were always improvements in the infrastructure
The classmates are very competent in a whole lot of various aspects which will expose you to various fields which you were unaware about before
The committees are in abundance hence every person could find fields that interest them and could find alot of exposure through the same
neg_sentences: There were few instances where the faculty felt incompetent or not in line with the topic which was dealt to them
Few committees were preferred by some teachers while others were neglected hence there was some partiality regarding the same
There was alot of instances of loops in management this leading to very slow administrative work and approvals
review_data.title: Reality of a SRCCian
review_data.name: Vikrant

content.title: Student view on course curriculum
content.content: The course is not in life with real world the internship provided helps alot in getting the real world exposure but the course itself lacks in providing the need of the hour and hence it doesn't make a person ready to go out and earn and there is a huge lag in these areas

content.title: Top companies providing internship and stipend
content.content: DE Shaw , EY , GT , Zomato and various companies offers internship and full time offers offering stipend from 15000 to 75000 per month . There were also government internships which were great for getting into MCA related jobs

content.title: Placement provided by the college and average package
content.content:
The placement market was impacted alot due to the post COVID effects but the college had some great placement and internship offers reaching upto 31L per annum .
The average package ranged around 5-6 Lakhs per annum

content.title: Total fees of the course
content.content: The year wise fees paid by me was around 24,000 and it was cumulative of all fees there was not any extra fees the relaxation provided for category was around 150rs and the fees structure of my fellow mates was similar varying only because of the category. There was no system of scholarship that I am aware of and there were Alumni form fees of 700rs and once a management fees of around 300 was charged aside there were no other extra fees charged

content.title: College events and various activities
content.content: There was alot of social and sports gatherings. But the environment was also brutally competitive hence making it very hard to enjoy other events . The college had various committees related events which invited various guets like Karan aujhla etc and hence giving people who love events and get together a great opportunity to explore and enjoy

content.title: Student views on the faculty and exams
content.content:
The exams are dependent on the CBCS model and consists of 4-6 exams per semester. There are alot of instances of inconsistency in marking of the exams.
The faculty to student ratio is not appropriate as required hence alot of classes being delayed and not taken for weeks and then rushed at last the faculties are approachable and helping aside from few.

content.title: Admission process of the college
content.content: The college is ranked the best in Asia for commerce hence it provides the best exposure than others . The admission process was merit based when I applied for and it all took place on DU Portal and was very easy going. The cut off list would be launched by SRCC after a week for next cutoff and upon clearing the same the admission would be successful and reflected in portal

content.title: Night Life
content.content: The gym , cafes and public area are a charm of North campus hence the night life is always alive with presence of various cafes a public park various cafes like Bistro, public library is also available to read

review_data.review_images_title: Shri Ram College of Commerce - [SRCC]|New Delhi

pos_sentences: The college is not politically active unlike other DU colleges
The Girls to Boys Ratio in the college is about 53:47
The college has good infrastructure like the auditorium and sports complex
neg_sentences: The campus is very small, for Asia's best commerce college especially
The faculty is no doubt experienced but some of them don't understand student emotions and still live by the school standards of teaching
review_data.title: SRCC: The Commerce Dream
review_data.name: Anonymous

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview
content.content: Bcom Hons curriculum is considered obsolete even the university has amended the course. It's also a pity that the best college in the country is not able to implement it practically and business knowledge till date is being practiced through rote learning.

content.title: Placement Experience
content.content:
A lot of students don't actually sit for placements as they want to pursue professional courses or UPSC or Masters but from the number of students that sit in placements, almost all get good jobs in the industry. SRCC is famous for its placement and internship opportunities.
Highest package is about 40lpa and average is around 12-14lpa.
95% of students get placed.
I am pursuing CA so I'll sit in placements for articleship

content.title: Fees and Financial Aid
content.content:
Total Fees: 33425
Includes Admission, Development, Lab, Library fees. There are numerous scholarships read the SRCC handbook of information for more details. Some of them are HN Maheshwari Scholarship, Alumni Scholarship, DU Scholarship

content.title: Campus Life
content.content:
Naming all events won't be possible but the biggest ones are Crossroads, Business Conclave and the TEDxSRCC annual event. Fest season in DU is around Jan to March.
There are more than 60+ societies in SRCC which help in the overall development of an individual. There are more than 4 floors of books 
The sports complex is huge and has a variety of opportunities for all.
Societies as mentioned earlier are very developed in SRCC and have a huge impact when deciding which college to choose. Some of them are Enactus, TEDx, 180DC etc

content.title: Faculty
content.content:
Faculties are pretty much approachable

Best Faculties (1st Sem): Renu Agarwal Ma'am, Dipika Bansal Ma'am, Smita Sharma Ma'am

Faculties you shouldn't get: RK Sah
He is the British era teacher with unnecessary strictness for unnecessary things. Attendance is an issue in DU and he'll not give you attendance no matter what. He'll make you stand for issues not under your control like having chalk and duster in the class and turning on the Air Conditioner.

Relevance of the course curriculum is decent but the way it's taken in college is obsolete. The practical aspects are often ignored and the curriculum stays to the traditional rote learning style.

content.title: Admission
content.content:
I applied to this college only and it's because of it's brand image. The placements are worth it here are well. 12-14 lpa is the average package which is higher than many of the IIT's as well. 
SRCC has many societies which make this college the best college. The societies are highly active and more practical knowledge is imparted by these societies rather than the classrooms of SRCC.

Admission is through the CUET UG examination and the General Cutoff for 2024 was 782/800. The admission experience isn't very pleasant because NTA conducts the exam but the University has a good mechanism for admission and I truly appreciate its efforts in streamlining admissions

review_data.review_images_title: Shri Ram College of Commerce - [SRCC]|New Delhi

pos_sentences: The faculty is great and all the teachers explain things, classes are also conducted regularly
The infrastructure is really good. We have AC in all the classes, the projectors, desks and computers are all up to date and functioning.
The sports complex is just awesome. It looks like it is out of a movie.
neg_sentences: The timetable is very unplanned and sometimes we have classes from 830am to 6pm with just half hour break in between
The college culture is very toxic and competitive. All the students are overachieving hence some students may find it hard to adjust.
The cafeteria food is average at best. They have recently upgraded it to systemized online orders but the food quality has changed with catering
review_data.title: SRCC: The Dream College
review_data.name: Mayara Shrotriya

content.title: Course Curriculum Overview
content.content: The curriculum is relevant to some extent but also includes several topics that are outdated. The college follows the same curriculum are other DU colleges. One thing is that the syllabus is too vast compared to the semester duration, so often teachers are unable to cover it in class. The finance syllabus is closely linked to the CFA syllabus so that is an added advantage.

content.title: Placement Experience
content.content: Placements are offered by the college, and companies like Deutche Bank, KPMG, Deloitte, BOFA, visit the campus. Last year, the highest package was 35LPA and the average package was 13LPA. Usually the students are getting placed as Analysts in these firms. About 50% of the total students are able to secure placements. However, due to the college alumni network and brand name, everyone can secure a job externally as well. I am planning on giving CAT and securing admission to IIM to pursue MBA, as are many of my peers. Others are planning to do CA or UPSC.

content.title: Fees and Financial Aid
content.content: Our fees per year as general student is around 30K but it is increased about 10% every year approx. The exact fee paid for this year was 31280 INR. For other categories, it is about 28-29k annually. Up to full scholarship can also be availed through scholarship programs. There is also 'Earn while you learn program' on merit cum need basis

content.title: Campus Life
content.content: Our college fest, Crossroads is one of the best in DU circle and it is typically held in April-May. There are over 50 societies in the college which provides you ample opportunity to get engaged in student activities and also an active student council. The society culture is a bit obsessive and every student is engaged in one thing or the other. Hence, some find it toxic as well. The college library is automated with computer check in and check out with wide availability of all kinds of books( even fiction and philosophy). So extracurriculars can be done by joining the respective societies (Dramatics, Dance, Fine arts) and sports is managed by the sports committee. Trials are held for all sports for the freshers.

content.title: Faculty
content.content: So the faculty is mostly very friendly and try their best to clear the concept. Specially, some highly qualified faculty like Ms. Rachna Jawa and Ms. Dipika Bansal are great guides and help you out with other things also apart from studies. Each subject includes 160 marks, out of which 90 are for the sem end exams and 70 are internal marks( with the faculty) Unfortunately most teachers are not liberal with these internal marks so you are engaged with activities, presentations, assignments and tests during the whole semester for these 70 marks. The end sem exams are medium difficulty.

content.title: Admission
content.content:
I had gotten admission in NMIMS, Symbiosis Pune, St. Xaviers Mumbai, St. Xaviers Kolkata. However, I chose SRCC because it is by far the best commerce college in India. It was my dream and my first choice and I was beyond happy when I got the Acceptance letter.
The admission is done through the CUET-UG exam conducted by NTA. For B.com(H), we have to opt for the subjects Accountancy/Math, Economics, Business Studies, English. Each subject is for 200 marks so the total comes to 800. The cutoff is 780 for general category. Once scores are declared, colleges are allotted on basis of preference lists prepared during the DU counselling process.

data.question: Do SRCC students get into IIM Ahmedabad?

basic.answer:
Though Shri Ram College of Commerce has high cut-offs for admission at the graduation level, it is incorrect to assume that all SRCC students who pass the CAT exam will be admitted to IIM Ahmadabad. It is important to remember that work experience is highly valued at IIM Ahmadabad.

Many students from other colleges apply to prestigious institutes. Nothing can stop you from getting into IIM Ahmedabad if you are determined to do so. So remember that regardless of where you studied, you can still get into IIM Ahmedabad.

qna_data.question: Which is better to do MBA - SRCC GBO or DTU DSM?

basic.answer:
An MBA from SRCC GBO is better than DTU DSM. My friend was a student of S.R.C.C. G.B.O and shared a few pros and cons of the program she experienced throughout her program. 

Pros:

  • You get to associate yourself with the well-established SRCC brand name. The top companies safe well aware of this brand and flock here for placements.
  • SRCC has excellent infrastructural facilities some of which include a PA system, a projector, and centralized air-conditioning.
  • SRCC has a massive sports complex that was made for the commonwealth games. It has top-notch facilities like athletes’ changing rooms, a gymnasium, and much more.
  • GBO has a highly qualified and learned faculty pool. The majority of the professors are alumni of top institutes like IIMs and FMS.
  • Baking affiliated with Delhi University, SRCC shared many core professors with the FMS.
  • The placement scenario is great and some top recruiters include EY, Dell, HCL, Novartis, Baxter, DCM, etc. Some companies visiting FMS allow SRCC students to sit for placements. 

Cons:

  • GBO is not an MBA but a Post Graduate Diploma in G.B.O.
  • SRCC is famous for its UG courses so the P.G.D.G.B.O. Program is yet to receive recognition.

The only thing I can comment on about DTU DSM is that the crowd quality is poor because of low cutoffs. Placements-wise too, DTU DSM takes the lead while SRCC takes the backseat.

qna_data.question: What is the admission procedure in SRCC for B.Com?

author.name: Jia Bhatia
author.title: studied Bachelor of Commerce & Master of Commerce at Shri Ram College of Commerce (2015)

basic.answer:
SRCC provides honours courses only in B.Com (hons) or Economics (hons) for which Maths is compulsory in 12th. 

The procedure is as follows: 

  • You will be selected on the basis of calculating your best 4 subject’s marks making sure that 1 language is counted in it. 
  • Fill in the online form and mention the college names as preference. 
  • Wait for the cutoff and see whether you have cleared SRCC cutoff or not. 
  • Then go to the college with all your academic documents, including identity or address proofs to complete the admission process. 

It is recommended that you score a 97.5 - 97.25% or above if you are from the unreserved category.

qna_data.question: Which is better: H.B.Econ. from SRCC or IPM from IIM Indore?

author.name: Amrapali Patel
author.title: MBA from Indian Institute of Management Indore (2020)

basic.answer:
SRCC is an established and well-known institution affiliated with the University of Delhi. The institution has a pretty good faculty and the curriculum being taught there is also considered to be of high standards. If you are planning to prepare a solid CV for your career, I would suggest that you opt for a course of your interest at SRCC. 

These are just some views I gathered by interacting with students of these institutes. 

  • The curriculum followed at IPM has been mocked by several candidates because of its diversity. It does not include specific topics for a particular specialization. 
  • However, for the batch of 2016-21, a new curriculum has been introduced by the authorities which is more focussed on areas like Economics, Quantitative aptitude, Philosophy, Psychology, and Sociology. 
  • These areas are also considered to be the 5 pillars of management at the PGDM level by many individuals working in the field of business and management.
  • The placement of the institution is also quite good with the average package approximately equal to the amount which usually gets offered to candidates studying at the Postgraduate level. 
Categories Economics (Hons.) at SRCC IPM at IIM Indore
Course Fee 45,000 26 lakh
Course Duration 3 years 5 years
Highest CTC 25 LPA 28 LPA
Average CTC 8-10 LPA 15-18 LPA
Recruiting Companies Deloitte, KPMG, EY, Amazon, etc. ICICI Bank, American Express, Mindtree, HCL, etc.

My brother was eligible for admission at SRCC but instead, he opted for IPM because it was favoring his interests, environment, and several other factors. You can too make a decision based on your interests and several other factors which you think are important for your career.

article.description:
Shri Ram College of Commerce commonly known as SRCC is affiliated to Delhi University. The college is primarily known for its Commerce, Management and Economics streams. There are 8 academic departments in SRCC like, Commerce, Economics, Mathematics, Hindi, Political Science and few others. Shri Ram College of Commerce offers two UG and PG courses and one PG Diploma course. In Undergraduate curriculum, the college offers B.A and B.com. B.A course and for Postgraduate level M.A and M.Com courses are offered.

SRCC was established in 1926 and is located in the North Campus of Delhi University. NAAC has accredited the college with a Grade 'A+'. NIRF 2023 ranked SRCC at 11th position. The college has a disciplined, progressive, lively and healthy environment where advanced holistic learning is provided with the help of technology. It emphasizes three facets of integrated learning, such as, physical, intellectual and value education.

The college promotes academic excellence by providing meritorious students with financial aid. There are several scholarship facilitations such as SRCC's Students Union Scholarship, SRCC Alumni Association Scholarship, Sultan Chand Trust Scholarship and many more. 

Table of Content
  1. SRCC Quick Updates
  2. SRCC Rankings & Accreditations
  3. SRCC Courses & Fees
  4. SRCC Admissions Process
  5. SRCC Placements
  6. SRCC Scholarships
  7. SRCC Facilities
  8. SRCC FAQs

SRCC Rankings & Accreditations

  • Ranked 11 by NIRF Ranking 2023 for the College Category
  • Ranked 12 by NIRF Ranking 2022 for the College Category 

Read more: SRCC Rankings

SRCC Courses & Fees

The SRCC offers 2 courses in UG and 3 courses at PG level. There are details of courses in tabular format: 

Courses Course Details Selection Criteria
B.A (Hons.)  Duration: 3 years
Eligibility Criteria: Candidates should have passed 10+2 level with 45% marks in aggregate  		 CUET
B.Com (Hons.) Duration: 3 years 
Eligibility Criteria: Applicants must pass 10+2 level with 45% marks in aggregate 
M.A Duration: 2 years 
Eligibility Criteria: Students must have done graduation in related fields 		 CUET PG
M.Com Duration: 2 years 
Eligibility Criteria: Applicants need to pass a Bachelor's degree in related fields 
PG Diploma in Global Business Operations Duration: 2 years
Eligibility Criteria: Candidates should pass graduation in related disciplines		 Entrance Exam followed by GD & PI
 

Read more: SRCC Courses & Fees

SRCC Admission Process 2024

SRCC admission to all courses (except PG Diploma in Global Business Operation) is based on scores obtained in the CUET examination. Students who want to take admission to the PG Diploma program must obtain a valid score in the entrance exam conducted by SRCC. Shortlisted candidates will be called for the further selection process. SRCC admission process includes appearing for the CUET examination and then appearing in the CSAS seat allotment. Registrations for admission at SRCC start after CUET result declarations. Candidates must select Delhi University while filling out the CUET application can register themselves on the DU CSAS portal and choose SRCC and course preferences. The entire selection process is done via the DU CSAS portal for both UG and PG courses in multiple rounds. The admission process is as follows:

Step 1: Appear for the Entrance Examination

SRCC admissions for all courses at affiliated colleges, faculties, and departments are based on scores obtained in the entrance examination. The table below lists the entrance exam accepted for various courses at Delhi University:

SRCC Courses Entrance Exam
BA (Hons), B.Com (Hons) CUET UG
MA, M.Com CUET PG

Step 2: Registration on DU CSAS Portal and Filling of Courses and College Preferences

Candidates who qualify the entrance examination must register on the Common Seat Allocation System (CSAS) Portal of Delhi University for the seat allotment. Once the registration is done, candidates will be asked to fill college and course preferences. 

Step 3: Seat Allocation

The seat allocation will be done in multiple rounds for all programs. Seats are allocated based on scores obtained in the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) or other national-level tests, combination of college and program chosen, category (SC/ST/OBC/EWS/UR) of the candidate, and availability of seats. 

Step 4: Blocking of Seats and Final Admission

Candidates can check the seat allotment result by logging into Delhi University’s Common Seat Allocation System (CSAS) dashboard. Upon acceptance of seat, the university will check eligibility, verify documents, and confirm admission after receiving the admission fees. 

Read more: SRCC Admission 2024

SRCC Placement

SRCC's placement cell facilitates UG courses like B.A (Hons.), B.Com (Hons.). The placement cell is an expert body integrated for facilitating recruitment. The college organises two kinds of placement, one is Summer Placements and another is Final Placements. In the placement drives of the college, there are 100+ recruiting companies which have offered over 320 job opportunities to the aspirants. Top recruiting companies offer not only placements but also fellowships, internships and articleships. 

The participating companies offer jobs related to finance, HR, Marketing and other departments. The details of the placement is given below in the tabulated form: 

Particulars Placements Statistics 2024
No. of recruiters 44
No. of offers made 160
Highest Package INR 35 LPA
Average Package INR 12.73 LPA
Recruiters  McKinsey & Co, Boston Consulting Group, Bank of America, Groww, A&W Capital
Companies which participated in the placement drives are: 
Google Citi Bank
BCG D E Shaw & Co
Deloitte PWC
Zomato KPMG
McKinsey & Company LEK Consulting
RSA Barclays 
Indus Insights ATKearney 
AIG

Read more: SRCC Placement

SRCC Scholarship

SRCC offers various scholarship programs to the meritorious and economically poor background students. The college offers a total number of 18 scholarship aids to the aspirants. The details of the scholarships are given below: 

  • SRCC's Students Union Scholarships: The two need-cum-merit scholarships are awarded to the students of B.A (Hons.) Economics and B.Com (Hons.). The reward is INR 12K per annum for the students of second year
  • SRCC Alumni Association Scholarship: This one need-cum-merit scholarship is for the students of 1st year of B.A (Hons.) Economics or B.Com (Hons.). If the students can score average 60% marks in aggregate in the second and third semester then the scholarship aid will be continued. The reward of the scholarship is 12K per annum.
  • Sultan Chand Trust Scholarship: The two scholarships are for the students of 2nd year and 3rd year of B.Com (Hons.). These will be provided only to the students who are toppers. The amount is 12K per annum.
  • Mitsubishi UFJ Foundation Scholarship: This scholarship facility can avail 12 students of UG curriculum and it will be provided to the 1st, 2nd and 3rd year of the students. Only 3 students of B.Com (Hons.) and one student of B.A (Hons.) Economics can have this opportunity. To avail this aid the candidates need to get 75% in the previous examination with 25% in the interview. This scholarship can be availed both by General category and reservation categories. The reward is for US $420 each of the students. 

Other scholarships are: 

  • MC Shukla Scholarship
  • T.S. Grewal Scholarship
  • Kanwar Lal Memorial Scholarship
  • C.B.Gupta Memorial Scholarship
  • Prem Handa Memorial Scholarship
  • Pt. Kanahya Lal Dayawanti Punj Scholarship
  • Manoj Kumar Memorial Scholarship
  • College Scholarship
  • KPMG Scholarship
  • Scholarship for Reservation Categories
  • All India Entrance Scholarship
  • Students Aid Fund and Fee Concession
  • Neeru Singh and Analjit Singh Scholarship

Read more: SRCC Scholarship

SRCC Facility

  • Library: The college has a good stock of books and resources in the central library. The library consists of 80 thousand books, subscription of 80 national, international journals, magazines, daily newspapers. The library has seating capacity of 300 students at a time. There are not only printed materials but also resources in electronic forms like CD ROM, DVD ROM, Video Cassette etc. 
  • Hostel: The SRCC offers both girls and boys hostel facilities. The girls hostel has 53 and boys hostel has 144 accommodation facilities along with other amenities such as mess, common room, laundry services and Wifi. The girls hostel is named Shri Ram Memorial Girl Hostel and boys hostel is Shri Ram College of Commerce. 
  • Sports: The SRCC has sport's facilities in innumerable games such as Aquatics, Archery, Badminton, Ball Badminton, Baseball, Basketball, Cross Country, Chess, Cricket, Football, Hockey, Judo, Table Tennis, Lawn Tennis, Yoga and so on. The is a multipurpose sports stadium, fitness centre, physiotherapy center, swimming pool etc. 
  • Faculty: The faculty at SRCC is highly equipped with the knowledge required in the current world. The members of the faculty are graduates from the eminent colleges of Canada, The United States and India. The college has experienced faculty across all the departments. The number of faculties college has:
    • Associate Professors: 25+
    • Assistant Professors: 10+
    • One of the most experienced economics and commerce faculty with more than 20+ staff members Check: SRCC Faculty

Other facilities provided by the college are : 

  • College Auditorium
  • Seminar Room
  • Health Infrastructure
  • Canteen
  • Computer labs
  • Virtual lab

Read more: SRCC Reviews 

SRCC FAQs

Ques. What is the procedure for admission to UG courses at SRCC?

Ans. SRCC offers admission to any UG program will be done through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET). The final selection will be based on the CUET marks followed by the counseling process. The final shortlisting will be done on the basis of the performance in the Personal Interview round conducted by the respective department. Shortlisted candidates will be called for further selection procedures. 

Ques. Which courses are famous in SRCC?

Ans. Some of the popular UG courses at SRCC include B.Tech, BA, B.Com, and BBA. The popular PG courses at SRCC include MBA, MBBS, and ME/M.Tech. SRCC was rated #1 out of 225 colleges in India in the 2023 India Today ratings, so the Commerce courses are particularly sought-after.

Ques. What is the rating of SRCC?

Ans. NIRF has ranked SRCC Delhi at 11th position in the College Category, with a score of 68.86. SRCC Commerce ranking by India Today is 1 out of 225 colleges in India in 2023 and the ranking for Commerce by The Week is 1 out of 107 colleges in India in 2023.

Ques. Which entrance exam does SRCC accept for admissions? 

Ans. SRCC accepts CUET for UG courses. Admission to PG courses at SRCC is dependent on your scores in the CUET PG exam. The final selection will be based on the CUET marks followed by the counseling process. SRCC also offers a PG Diploma course in Global Business Operations, which has its own entrance exam. 

Ques. Who are the top recruiters of SRCC?

Ans. Some of the top companies that participated as recruiters in the SRCC placements included Google, Citi Bank, BCG, D E Shaw & Co, Deloitte, PWC, Zomato, KPMG, McKinsey & Company, LEK Consulting, RSA, Barclays, Indus Insights, ATKearney, AIG, etc.

Ques. Does SRCC offer scholarships?

Ans. Yes, SRCC offers various scholarship programs to meritorious students and students with economically poor backgrounds. The college offers a total number of 18 scholarship aids to the aspirants including schemes such as SRCC's Students Union Scholarship, the SRCC Alumni Association Scholarship, the Sultan Chand Trust Scholarship, the Mitsubishi UFJ Foundation Scholarship, the MC Shukla Scholarship, T.S. Grewal Scholarship, the Kanwar Lal Memorial Scholarship, the C.B.Gupta Memorial Scholarship, the Prem Handa Memorial Scholarship, the Pt. Kanahya Lal Dayawanti Punj Scholarship, the Manoj Kumar Memorial Scholarship, the SRCC College Scholarship, the KPMG Scholarship, the Scholarship for Reservation Categories

All India Entrance Scholarship, the Students Aid Fund and Fee Concession, and the Neeru Singh and Analjit Singh Scholarship.

Ques. What is the CUET cutoff for various courses at SRCC?

Ans. The expected CUET UG cutoff marks for B.Com (Hons.) is 770 - 780 and for BA (Hons) Economics the cutoff is expected to be 765 - 775 in the general category. The expected CUET PG cutoff marks for MA Economics to are 200-220 and 220-250 for admission to the M.Com program at SRCC. 

Ques. What are placement packages like at SRCC placements?

Ans. The SRCC 2024 Phase 1 placements had over 160 offers with the highest package being INR 35 LPA and the average package being INR 12.73 LPA. 44 recruiters, including McKinsey & Co, Boston Consulting Group, Bank of America, Groww, A&W Capital, Google, Accenture, Microsoft, Deloitte, etc. participated in the placement drive.

Ques. Can I get into SRCC with 85% marks in 10+2?

Ans. Yes, 85% marks should be sufficient for admission into SRCC. The eligibility criteria for UG programs is 10+2 with at least 45% marks in aggregate. However, admission also depends on your score in the CUET exam. If you do not meet the CUET cutoff for your course, you will be denied admission into SRCC. 

Ques. What are the extracurricular activities conducted by SRCC? 

Ans. The facilities or arrangements are included in student's society at SRCC, Book Club, Commerce Society, Maths and Computer Society, Corporate Interaction Cell, Debating Society, Drama Society, Economic Society, Entrepreneurship Development Cell, Fine Arts Society and a lot more.

postAuthor.authorDescription:
About Himanshu Yadav

Himanshu Yadav is a passionate writer who is currently working as a Content Writer at Collegedunia. He loves to read and research before initiating any writing assignment and is currently compiling articles for engineering aspirants. His articles are filled with insights around the admission process, placement, cutoff, eligibility criteria, scholarship, and other information required to have an overview of different Indian engineering colleges. The articles that he writes act as one-stop info guides for students searching the internet web world about engineering colleges.

Himanshu Yadav, a born and bred of Faridabad, Haryana, has been an ardent writer owing to his love for accumulating knowledge. He has a Degree in Journalism and Mass Communication from Manav Rachna International University and Digital Marketing certifications from Google and Hubspot.

He has embarked upon his journey with Collegedunia recently. Before this, he wrote entertainment and lifestyle articles for Womansera magazine.

If not on his laptop curating new insightful write-ups, you can find Himanshu browsing through articles and videos about new cars, bikes, and gadgets. He is a traveling enthusiast who loves the serenity offered in mountains. You will find him focused on his laptop but in his free time, he loves to share thoughts with his colleagues. He is a team person and you’ll see him greeting everyone with a smile.

Words From Himanshu Yadav

There’s a lot of information available on the internet today which makes it hard for students to differentiate real facts from fake information. When looking for information about any college, there could be a lot of fluff available. And the inability to find a trusted source for facts and figures and processes can hold them back. With my articles, I ensure that only information from trusted sources is offered in a short and crisp format. I take up my articles keeping students and their perspectives in mind to write simple yet informative pieces.

What I write about colleges and institutes is a summary of my in-depth research on the same. The information is put in short format to save a student’s time while delivering everything they would want to know.

Favorite Quote

“The future depends on what you do today.” — Mahatma Gandhi

Students should keep in mind that each day matters when it comes to building a brighter future. It might seem like just another day in life but when you look back, it will be the small progress you make each day that will matter and define your journey.

About Collegedunia

Collegedunia, established in 2014, revolutionized the way students and parents consumed information regarding colleges and other educational institutions. The platform acts as a search engine, offering every bit of information regarding the admission process, placement, rankings, course structure, fees, entrance, and much more for educational institutions in India and abroad.

With over 700 enthusiasts on board, Collegedunia seeks to empower students with genuine information before they commence their journey of higher studies. Here, you can find relevant data at the tip of your fingers to make an informed decision for your future.

comments.content: can i take admission in srcc college in music base??

replies.content: Yes, you can apply for admission to Shri Ram College of Commerce (SRCC) under the Extra-Curricular Activities (ECA) quota based on your proficiency in music. SRCC allocates ECA seats in categories such as Music (Instrumental: Indian) and Dance, etc.

comments.content: Where can I fill the application form of srcc for ug for admission?

replies.content: Candidates applying for CUET UG must select Delhi University while filling out the application form and choose subjects in which they have appeared in class 12 or equivalent. Candidates who qualify in the entrance examination must register on the Delhi University Common Seat Allocation System (CSAS) Portal to choose a course at SRCC. Once the registration is done, candidates will be asked to fill in their college and course preferences before the release of merit lists.

For BA (Hons) Economics and B.Com (Hons) courses, CUET UG scores are accepted. SRCC accepts CUET PG for admission to MA and M.Com programs. For admission, candidates must register for the DU CSAS (UG & PG) registration process and choose SRCC and available courses as their preference. Based on the preferences & reservation criteria, Delhi University releases the seat allotment results in multiple rounds.

metaData.whats_new: 17 Jun, 2025 As per the latest report released by Delhi University, a total of 63,387 PG & 6,015 B.Tech registrations have been made till now, resulting in a steady rise in applicant numbers for the academic session 2025-2026.
metaData.whats_new_priority:
17 Jun, 2025 CUET UG 2025 Answer Key has been released on June 17, 2025. Candidates can raise objections till June 20, 2025. Further, NTA will tentatively declare CUET UG 2025 Result by the 1st week of July. To know more, click here.

17 Jun, 2025 DU CSAS UG 2025 portal is now active @ugadmission.uod.ac.in. The UG admission registration based on CUET UG 2025 will commence anytime soon.

14 Jun, 2025 SRCC, Delhi University has released the Waiting List of Candidates after the 3rd List for batch 2025-2027 for PG Diploma Global Business Operation Admission 2025. Click here to check.

schemaJsonLd.1: {"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":" What is the procedure for admission to UG courses at SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" SRCC offers admission to any UG program will be done through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET). The final selection will be based on the CUET marks followed by the counseling process. The final shortlisting will be done on the basis of the performance in the Personal Interview round conducted by the respective department. Shortlisted candidates will be called for further selection procedures."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Which courses are famous in SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" Some of the popular UG courses at SRCC include B.Tech, BA, B.Com, and BBA. The popular PG courses at SRCC include MBA, MBBS, and ME\/M.Tech. SRCC was rated #1 out of 225 colleges in India in the 2023 India Today ratings, so the Commerce courses are particularly sought-after."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What is the rating of SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" NIRF has ranked SRCC Delhi at 11th position in the College Category, with a score of 68.86. SRCC Commerce ranking by India Today is 1 out of 225 colleges in India in 2023 and the ranking for Commerce by The Week is 1 out of 107 colleges in India in 2023."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Which entrance exam does SRCC accept for admissions?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" SRCC accepts CUET for UG courses. Admission to PG courses at SRCC is dependent on your scores in the CUET PG exam. The final selection will be based on the CUET marks followed by the counseling process. SRCC also offers a PG Diploma course in Global Business Operations, which has its own entrance exam."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Who are the top recruiters of SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" Some of the top companies that participated as recruiters in the SRCC placements included Google, Citi Bank, BCG, D E Shaw & Co, Deloitte, PWC, Zomato, KPMG, McKinsey & Company, LEK Consulting, RSA, Barclays, Indus Insights, ATKearney, AIG, etc."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Does SRCC offer scholarships?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" Yes, SRCC offers various scholarship programs to meritorious students and students with economically poor backgrounds. The college offers a total number of 18 scholarship aids to the aspirants including schemes such as SRCC's Students Union Scholarship, the SRCC Alumni Association Scholarship, the Sultan Chand Trust Scholarship, the Mitsubishi UFJ Foundation Scholarship, the MC Shukla Scholarship, T.S. Grewal Scholarship, the Kanwar Lal Memorial Scholarship, the C.B.Gupta Memorial Scholarship, the Prem Handa Memorial Scholarship, the Pt. Kanahya Lal Dayawanti Punj Scholarship, the Manoj Kumar Memorial Scholarship, the SRCC College Scholarship, the KPMG Scholarship, the Scholarship for Reservation CategoriesAll India Entrance Scholarship, the Students Aid Fund and Fee Concession, and the Neeru Singh and Analjit Singh Scholarship."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What is the CUET cutoff for various courses at SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" The expected CUET UG cutoff marks for B.Com (Hons.) is 770 - 780 and for BA (Hons) Economics the cutoff is expected to be 765 - 775 in the general category. The expected CUET PG cutoff marks for MA Economics to are 200-220 and 220-250 for admission to the M.Com program at SRCC."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What are placement packages like at SRCC placements?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" The SRCC 2024 Phase 1 placements had over 160 offers with the highest package being INR 35 LPA and the average package being INR 12.73 LPA. 44 recruiters, including McKinsey & Co, Boston Consulting Group, Bank of America, Groww, A&W Capital, Google, Accenture, Microsoft, Deloitte, etc. participated in the placement drive."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Can I get into SRCC with 85% marks in 10+2?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" Yes, 85% marks should be sufficient for admission into SRCC. The eligibility criteria for UG programs is 10+2 with at least 45% marks in aggregate. However, admission also depends on your score in the CUET exam. If you do not meet the CUET cutoff for your course, you will be denied admission into SRCC."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What are the extracurricular activities conducted by SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" The facilities or arrangements are included in student's society at SRCC, Book Club, Commerce Society, Maths and Computer Society, Corporate Interaction Cell, Debating Society, Drama Society, Economic Society, Entrepreneurship Development Cell, Fine Arts Society and a lot more."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" How many companies participated in Shri Ram College of Commerce placements in 2024?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" According to recent data, around 44 companies visited for recruitment at SRCC campus in 2024 for Phase 1. Names of the top recruiters include McKinsey & Co, Boston Consulting Group, Bank of America, Groww, A&W Capital."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Who were the top recruiters at SRCC placements 2024?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" Some of the top recruiting companies during Placements 2024include McKinsey & Co, Boston Consulting Group, Bank of America, Groww, A&W Capital and many more."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Does SRCC have 100% placement?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" SRCC placements marks 90% successfully placed students in top MNCs in 2023as per the relevant data sources. Average package offered has been INR 13.2LPA."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What are the things to do to prepare for placements in SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"The training sessions are organized regularly and the right materials are provided by SRCC Placement Cell in the form of Casebooks and through social media campaigns.Keep posted up with the current affairs around the globe to get success in placements.Build a strong reasoning, logical aptitude to clear the interview rounds smoothly.Bring into a habit of reading newspapers for enhancing general awareness and vocabulary for getting qualified in placements."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" How many offers were made during SRCC placements 2024?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" About 160offers were made to the students sitting in placements at SRCC Placements 2024."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What is the highest placement in SRCC GBO?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" SRCC GBO Placements have seen highest package at INR 35LPA and average package of INR 12.73 LPA."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What is the eligibility criteria to Get Hostels at SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" To be eligible for a hostel room the candidates must have been admitted to the SRCC. The final allotments of rooms at SRCC hostels are purely on the merit of the marks obtained in the Qualifying marks."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What are the Cancellation Charges of SRCC?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" If the admission of any Students is withdrawn the students must Cancel their hostel admission the students will get a refund amount of INR 5,000 after deduction from the total fees paid by Candidates. However, actual mess expenses, electricity, and water expenses are to be paid by candidates."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Does SRCC Hostels provide any Concession in fees to the Physically Handicapped?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" Yes, Physically Handicapped students are exempted from payment of hostel fees as per University of Delhi Guidelines."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" What is the SRCC Hostel Fees?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" The total SRCC Hostel Fee is INR 57,850 for SRCC Boys and Girls Hostel fees."}},{"@type":"Question","name":" Which Candidates are exempted from getting Hostel in 2nd and 3rd year?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":" The Applicants who failed to get a Minimum of 70% attendance in a previous academic year are exempted from getting the SRCC hostel rooms."}}]}
